Title:
Species diversity of entomopathogenic fungi Metarhizium
anisopliae and M. flavoviride species complex isolated from insects in
Japan
Keywords:
green muscardine fungus, phylogenetic analysis,
translation elongation factor 1-alpha
Abstract:
Phylogenetic analysis of insect-derived isolates of M.
anisopliae and M. flavoviride species complex in Japan were conducted to
reveal their species diversity in Japan. Forty-seven isolates were
identified as 9 species, which include a species new to Japan. M.
pingshaense was the most frequently isolated species among the isolates;
23 isolates of them from insects of six orders (12 families) were
identified as this species. New host-pathogen combinations have been
found for two species with relatively narrow host ranges: Hymenoptera-M.
pemphigi and Orthoptera- and Phasmatodea-M. majus.
